tasks.description: Install JDK (Java Development Kit), configure a Java IDE (IntelliJ or Eclipse), and create a basic Hello World program to verify the setup.
tasks.name: Environment Setup

tasks.description: Learn Java syntax rules, primitive/non-primitive data types (int, double, String), operators (arithmetic, comparison), and basic input-output operations.
tasks.name: Basic Syntax & Data Types

tasks.description: Practice using conditional structures (if-else, switch-case) and looping constructs (for, while, do-while) for program flow management.
tasks.name: Control Flow Statements

tasks.description: Understand Java arrays (declaration, initialization, traversal) and method structures (defining parameters, return types, scope).
tasks.name: Arrays & Methods

tasks.description: Create classes, instantiate objects, define constructors, and understand field/method access using 'this' keyword.
tasks.name: Classes & Objects

tasks.description: Implement inheritance hierarchies (extends keyword), method overriding, abstract classes, and interface implementation.
tasks.name: Inheritance & Interfaces

tasks.description: Apply runtime polymorphism principles, encapsulation techniques (private fields, getters/setters), and static modifiers.
tasks.name: Polymorphism & Encapsulation

tasks.description: Organize code using packages, understand access control levels (public, private, protected), and import external libraries.
tasks.name: Packages & Access Modifiers

tasks.description: Manage runtime errors using try-catch blocks, create custom exceptions, and apply finally/throws clauses.
tasks.name: Exception Handling

tasks.description: Implement List (ArrayList), Set (HashSet), and Map (HashMap) interfaces with generics for type-safe collections.
tasks.name: Collections Framework

tasks.description: Explore core String methods (concat, slice, format), StringBuilder for mutable operations, and text parsing techniques.
tasks.name: String Manipulation

tasks.description: Create threads via Thread/Runnable, synchronize shared resources, and understand thread lifecycle states.
tasks.name: Multithreading Basics

tasks.description: Read/write text files using FileReader/FileWriter, binary streams, and leverage BufferedReader/PrintWriter utilities.
tasks.name: File I/O Operations

tasks.description: Establish JDBC connections, execute CRUD operations via SQL statements, and handle database exceptions.
tasks.name: JDBC Database Connectivity

tasks.description: Set up Maven/Gradle projects, manage dependencies via POM/build.gradle files, and compile using CLI/build tools.
tasks.name: Build Tools & Libraries

tasks.description: Create basic Swing interfaces (JFrame, JButton) or JavaFX scenes with simple event handling mechanisms.
tasks.name: GUI Development Introduction

tasks.description: Learn core concepts: definition, importance in programming, abstract data types (ADT) vs. implementation, and time complexity basics. Includes memory allocation principles.
tasks.name: Introduction to Data Structures

tasks.description: Study static/dynamic arrays, operations (access, insertion, deletion), multidimensional arrays, and practical implementation examples with complexity analysis.
tasks.name: Arrays Deep Dive

tasks.description: Cover singly/doubly linked lists: structure, node operations, traversal, edge-case handling, and comparisons with arrays. Implement insert/delete at positions.
tasks.name: Linked Lists

tasks.description: Learn stack operations (push/pop), LIFO principle, array vs. linked list implementations, and real-world use-cases like function call stacks.
tasks.name: Stacks

tasks.description: Understand FIFO principle, circular queues, priority queues implementation, enqueue/dequeue operations with array and linked list backends.
tasks.name: Queues

tasks.description: Study tree terminology (root, leaf, height), binary trees, properties, and traversal algorithms (pre-order, in-order, post-order) with recursive/iterative approaches.
tasks.name: Tree Fundamentals

tasks.description: Implement BST operations: search, insertion, deletion. Analyze balance concepts and worst-case scenarios leading to degenerate trees.
tasks.name: Binary Search Trees

tasks.description: Explore self-balancing with AVL rotations (LL, LR, RR, RL). Learn binary heaps: min-heap/max-heap properties and heapify operations.
tasks.name: AVL Trees & Heaps

tasks.description: Study hash functions, collision resolution (separate chaining, open addressing), load factor impact, and practical use-cases for fast lookups.
tasks.name: Hash Tables

tasks.description: Learn tries for string operations, structure design, prefix searching, and applications like autocomplete systems.
tasks.name: Trie Structures

tasks.description: Cover terminology (vertices, edges), adjacency matrix vs. list trade-offs, directed/undirected graphs, and weighted graphs representations.
tasks.name: Graph Representations

tasks.description: Implement BFS (queue-based) and DFS (stack/recursion) with path analysis. Compare use-cases like shortest path vs. connectivity checks.
tasks.name: Graph Traversals

tasks.description: Build a mini-project (e.g., contactbook using Trie/HashTable or social network with BFS). Document design choices and complexity.
tasks.name: Project Implementation

tasks.description: Create comparison tables of all data structures: strengths, weaknesses, and operation complexities. Solve mixed-problem sets to reinforce concepts.
tasks.name: Comprehensive Review
